data.title: Charlotte of Belgium
data.text:
Princess Charlotte of Belgium (Marie Charlotte Amélie Augustine Victoire Clémentine Léopoldine; 7 June 1840 – 19 January 1927) was a daughter of King Leopold I of Belgium by his second wife Princess Louise of Orléans (herself a daughter of Louis Philippe I) She was a sister of the future King Leopold II of Belgium. She was known as Carlota during her husband's short reign in Mexico.

Titles and styles[edit]

7 June 1840 – 27 July 1857 Her Royal Highness Princess Charlotte of Belgium, Princess of Saxe-Coburg-Gotha, Duchess of Saxony.

27 July 1857 – 10 April 1864 Her Imperial an Royal Highness Archduchess Charlotte, Archduchess and Princess of Austria, Princess Royal of Hungary, Bohemia and Croatia..

10 April 1864 – 19 June 1867 Her Imperial Majesty The Empress.

19 June 1867– 19 January 1927 Her Imperial Majesty Empress Charlotte of Mexico.
